div.l: This wenche þikke ⁊and wel y growen was
With camuse nose and eyen gray as glass
With buttokes brode and brestes rounde ⁊and hye
But right faire was hire here I wil nouȝt lye
¶ The ꝑperson of the town for she was so faire
In pᵘurpos was to make hire his hayr
Bothe of his catell ⁊and his mesuage
And strange he made it of hire mariage
His pᵘurpos was to be stowe hire hye
In to som worthi blood of Auncetrie
For holi cherches good moot ben dispended
On holy chirche blood þat is descended
Therefore he wold his holy blood honour
Thow þat he holy chirche sholde deuour
¶ Grete sokyn haþ þis meller out of doute
Wit whete and malt of al þe land a bowte
And nameliche þer was a grete college
Men clepeth þe soler halle at Caumbrigge
Ther was hire whete and ek hire malt ygrounde
And on a day in happed in a stownde
Syk lay the manciple on a maladie
Men wenden wisly þat he shulde die
For which this mellere stale boþe mele ⁊and korn
An hundred tyme more þānne bi forn
For there beforn he stal but curteysly
But now he was a thef outrageously
For which þe wardeyn chidde ⁊and made fare
But þer of sette þe Miller nouȝt a tare
He crakede bost ⁊and swor it was nouȝt so
Thanne were þer yonge scolers two
That dwelten in the halle of which I seye
Testyf þei were and lusty for to pleye
And oonly for her͗e mirthe ⁊and reuerie
Vppon þe warden bisyli þei crie
To yf hem leue but a litil stonde
To go to melle and seen here corn y gᵒrounde
And hardely þei dorste ley here nekke
The meller shuld not stele hem half a pekke
Of corn ne be sleight ne bi force hem Reue
And at þe laste þe wardeyn yaf hem leue
Iohn hight þat on and Aleyn highte þat oþer
Of oon towne were þei born þat highte strother
